intro: Hieracium dysharmostum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its invasive tendencies in some regions, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
